comments.body: strange thing is in the previous code, the passed image is not used. it always use testImageRootUid. That means testImageNonRootUid image is not tested at all?
Indeed, this function ignores the given ``image``, which is a bug. But in other functions, like ``doTestSubPathFSGroup``, it uses the given ``image``, ``testImageNonRootUid`` was used by other tests.

Sorry if I'm dense here, but what is EmptyDir on windows? 

/assign @timothysc
I don't quite understand your question. An EmptyDir is an empty dir. The only other thing would be if the ``Medium=memory`` is set, but that is ignored by Windows Kubelet.
If it's ignored by windows shouldn't it be [LinuxOnly]
Memory as a storage medium is not supported on Windows.  I am not sure what will happen in that case, but it will likely not work.

As I said, the ``Medium=memory`` doesn't really do anything Windows and a regular EmptyDir is created: https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/JMcp8g58Xk/ . This fact can also be seen in @andyzhangx 's comment, it can be seen that a regular folder is created if the source is memory / tmpfs.

It could arguably be considered a bug, since it doesn't have the same behaviour as on Linux (the volume is not stored in memory, nor will it be deleted on reboot).
This test case is not using EmptyDir as medium=memory so I don't think this memory issue should block this test.
Can someone run this test case on a windows platform to see if any changes to this test need to be made?
I did, and it works. I've already left a general comment about this yesterday.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +210,214 @@	/*
		Release : v1.15
		Testname: EmptyDir, Shared volumes between containers
		Description: A Pod created with an 'emptyDir' Volume, should share volumes between the containeres in the pod. The two busybox image containers shoud share the volumes mounted to the pod.
		The main container shoud wait until the sub container drops a file, and main container acess the shared data.

comments.body: Can we propose this for ConformanceIT  ?  BTW a nice follow on issue might be to add 'EmptyDir' to all these test descriptions.  This is a great test esp w/ diverging container runtimes, thanks !

Let's make sure the test is stable first before promoting to conformance.

EmptyDir is already specified at the top level describe for these tests.
